greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct prime divisors of n that are < sqrt(n).
comment: a(n) = 0 if and only if n = p^k where p is prime and k is 0, 1, or 2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 07 2020
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: if p^2 >= N then break fi;
mathematica: nmax = 90; CoefficientList[Series[Sum[x^(Prime[k] (Prime[k] + 1))/(1 - x^Prime[k]), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] // Rest
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)[,1]); sum(i=1,#f, f[i]^2<n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 07 2020
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 05 2020
